On november 12, 2018
[8257515]

Those forums are rather dead, so i was planning to bring a little life to it.
So i present to you, a brand new RP:

This is an empty world, without plants, animals, civilizations and any kind of life. It's just another lifeless planet in the deep space, but soon this will change... Something crashes in this planet, some kind of... Spaceship? With it, a single female, her species unknown, but with tremendous power. From the shards of her power, her children will rise. You, the new gods of this world!

Explanation
In this RP, the players are gods tasked to develop this lifeless planet, creating all sort of creatures that are up to their liking! Those creatures might even develop a little of intelligence and interact with their god... Destroying other God's creatures, declare war, make alliances, this is all possible, so i'm not expecting it to die unless no one joins.

Character Sheet
Name: Your name, how others will call you.
Appearance: How do your god look like? Human, Beast, Alien, anything really...
Skills:
Those are the initial skills your character can have, choose one, but in the future you can get more.
Creating- Bonus for creating things like objects and creatures or terraforming.
Magic- Bonus for using spells
Blessing- Bonus for blessing objects, creatures and specific individuals
Fighting- Bonus for when fighting with your fists or other weapons
Creature:
Type of creatures or things you are best at creating. More will be found later, and it's possible to learn like skills. Choose one for now.
Beasts- From Insects to Mammals, or small Reptilians to Powerful Dragons.
Plants- Flowers, Trees, Carnivore Plants, Treants...
Minerals- Creating all sort of minerals and jewels, could it lead to artificial life?
Element: Your elemental affinity!
For now, choose one of the basic elements:
Fire, Water, Wind or Earth.
Alignment: Lawful, Neutral or Chaos.

The following sheet will be used to create creatures when the thread starts:
Creature Sheet
You don't need to follow it, but when creating a creature i want you to explain those things:
Name
Type (Beast, Plant and Mineral for now)
Elemental Affinity (Neutral, Water, Fire, Earth or Wind for now)
Appearance
Habitat (If it's not present in the planet, it will die or mutate)
Nature (How it generally acts, it's carnivore or herbivore? Mating habits?)
Traits (Anything special about it? Like being poisonous or having good sight?)

Fighting

Creature:
Beasts

Element:
Water

Alignment: Chaotic Neutral, if that’s allowed.

Creature Sheet
Name: Droggy/ies
Type: Beast
Elemental Affinity: Earth
Appearance: Droggies are bipedal reptillian creatures, having mostly dark colored scales. Their eyes are dark and their pupils white, essentially, an inverted eye. They blink sideways. The babies usually stand at around the height of a fully blown balloon, but they grow fast, a human year is the equivalent to three for them.
Habitat: They reside in areas where there are thick amounts of prey.
Nature: Droggies are carnivorous creatures. As designed by Grok, they are meant to be independent creatures. They only attack when they feel threatened, ordered by Grok, or ordered by their pack leader. They attack in any means necessary, and will not stop until the pack leader decides to retreat. Not even Grok can stop them. He likes it that way. Their system of hierarchy is determined by skill, not legacy. The bravest, ‘kindest’ and strongest of the pack will be the leader. If there were multiple packs, a union of them would be called a Coven. They communicate via growls and body movement.
Traits: A Droggy is very fast, and good communicators in between the packs, making the chain of orders quick. They are also observant and usually silent. Usually.

DrWinner
SchroedingerI only know the game SCARAB and the noun 'scar'. So... can you explain?

Scar was created in 1989 and was created by screenwriters Irene Mecchi, Jonathan Roberts, and Linda Woolverton, and animated by Andreas Deja. The Pride Lands' reclusive heir presumptive, Scar is introduced in the first film as Simba's uncle and Mufasa's younger brother. Originally first-in-line to Mufasa's throne until he is suddenly replaced by Simba, Scar decides to lead an army of hyenas in his plot to take the throne by killing Mufasa and exiling Simba, ultimately blaming his brother's death on his nephew. Loosely based on King Claudius, the main antagonist of William Shakespeare's play Hamlet, Scar's villainy was additionally inspired by Adolf Hitler and Joseph Stalin. As the character's supervising animator, Deja based Scar's appearance on that of Irons himself, as well as the actor's Academy Award-winning performance as Claus von Bülow in Reversal of Fortune (1990). Before Irons was cast, the directors had considered offering the role to actors Tim Curry and Malcolm McDowell.

[8257515]

Okay, i think one week is enough. If someone wants to join later, they are free to do so.

Introduction
A soft, familiar voice is the first thing you hear. She speaks softly and with calm, certainly motherly, making even the most cold hearts warm up:
???Welcome to the world, children. I will not lie to you, the following journey will be hard, but i know you are capable of anything. Fill the world with life, build, reproduce, find friends and enemies. Show the whole universe why you came here, either to bring new life or destroy it completely.

Al'bastor and Indystria, you will be born in the Golden Citadel. Grok, Wilhelm, Charon and Uomi, you will be born in the Dark Citadel. C'thytik and Omniscience can choose either of them.

Golden Citadel
The Golden Citadel looks like a castle, its gigantic halls, towers, walls and other structures being made of pure gold, almost too shiny for your eyes, if you have at least one. The temple where you are born is even more... exaggerated, almost like the one who built wanted to show their amount of riches or power, several golden pillars adorned with diamonds being present in the room, along with a way simpler statue of a familiar female in a praying stance. You are born near this statue, along with your brothers and sisters, without any clues where you are besides your purpose.
The only other person here is someone wearing a heavy armor, also shiny and spotless like the walls of the castle and made of pure gold, a heavy sword and a golden shield in his back. he doesn't even looks at you, currently busy praying to the statue.

Dark Citadel
The Dark Citadel doesn't loses to the Golden Citadel in size, but it's way less... golden, and more dark like the name implies. While the problem of the Golden Citadel is being too bright, this Citadel is too dark. It has a sort of gothic architechiture, imponent but way less exaggerated, showing dark beauty instead of pure power.
In the temple where you are born, dark pillars adorned with rubies fill the room, and a fountain where a statue of a familiar female crying is the main decoration of this room. Her eyes are covered by her hands, but from under it comes a stream of water filling the fountain, you being born near this statue, along with your brother and sisters, without any clues besides your purpose. Maybe you should talk, or search for someone, since nobody came to meet you.

New Cycle
A new cycle comes, and the gods watch their creations evolve.
Lady Nature seems to be smiling to the planet, and by chance, unexpected things happen:
Symbiosis
Crystal Bud + Crystal Spire

By chance, a Crystal Bud ends up blooming in the surface. Normally, this individual would die, but something else happens: The crystal spire assimilates it, and those buds begin growing from the spire. The bud, using their communication net, communicate with the spire for maximum light absorption, as it now works like part of the spire itself, and the spire is able to grow several branchs full of the peculiar flowers.
Besides restoring mana and health, the flowers are quite nutritious and can be used as food, and the animals end up spreading the new rocky "plant" as they feed from it. Could it be the start of a new species?

C'thytik should name it.
Fungal Bloom + Astral Sphere
The Blightsowers are the main predators of the bloom, but it seems certain individuals begin to adapt to fight it. Some of the fungi begin to grow inside of the spheres, giving it way more resistence and an interesting ability: Absorbing water and launching attacks with it. One well aimed shot is enough to kill a Blightsower, extinguishing the fire completely.
After few years of evolution, however, it's now a completely new species: An elemental with a body made of water, using water attacks to defend itself from predators. This new evolution substitutes the Astral Sphere completely.
Indystria and Al'bastor should name it.

Intelligence
After years of evolution, the Mamana's brain seems to steadily develop on their own. Rather, they quickly adquire what it seems to be primitive intelligence. Small groups of individuals are now building bigger nests together, and coordinating to collect food for all of the group, making it easier to take care of the offspring. They are not properly communicating yet though, tools are far away yet and they don't even understand the concept of god. Still, it's a big step towards a real civilization.

Name: Needle nest
Type: Beast(insect?)
Element: Earth?
A large collection of thorny, surprisingly agile and flexible joints, that suspends itself over the fall of the cliffs surrounding the island. While it rarely moves, usually nesting on its surprisingly durable strands in the chasm, suspended between the two walls, they slowly mature. What they mature into is yet unknown and unobserved, but it seems like their skeletons make for great magic enhancement tools. The skeletons themselves in the meanwhile are surprisingly symmetrical, comprised of the center body and two elongations either side of it. While it has no highly developed senses, only relying on vague sight, it can feel invaders on its string surprisingly well, as well as strike out twoards percieved threats very quickly.
While difficult, it is not impossible to kill one of these, the answer being to get it to the surface where its isolation will not help.
